posts.title: Completing a Loading Page and Creating a Brand Logo

sections.content:
Today, I accomplished the following tasks:\n
1. Completed my front loading page.\n2. Created my own logo using AI and Canva.

This morning, I faced a challenging issue - my gradient background wasn't displaying correctly despite having the correct code. Neither GPT nor Google provided any clear solutions. After thorough research, I discovered that the problem was due to the missing 'height' attribute.

I organized my front page into manageable tasks, and I completed them all in a single day. I started by working on the loading animation, then created the brand logo, decided on the background, and finally, perfected the loading animation and transition to the Front Page.

One significant challenge when learning without a predefined design to follow is the risk of giving up on a desired webpage, animation, or algorithm in favor of something easier. In real-life scenarios, engineers often need to build something that's already been designed, leading them to adapt and persist through challenges.

posts.title: Upgrading my Burger Webpage Day 2, stucked.

sections.content:
Today, I:

1. Learned how to create hyperlinks for text in JSON using JavaScript.
2. Added comments to my blog HTML and JavaScript source codes.
3. Attempted to make an HTML form work with a PHP / Apache server.

I skipped a day of journaling because I was engrossed in trying to get information from an HTML form to my email or a database. After much tweaking, I still couldn't figure out why my computer isn't registering my PHP file on localhost. Even though I didn't manage to find the solution, I learned a lot about a local server, XAMPP, and why PHP and SQL are important. I will come back to this issue again.

After being stuck on the PHP XAMPP server issue, I decided to take a break from coding my burger website and read up on what makes a good front-end developer. I came across Codepen, which I had practiced with 2 years ago, and Three.JS, which contains some of the most amazing 3D visuals for web development. Learning that I can reuse code from their public domain, I was on cloud nine. I scrolled in awe through thousands of visuals in Codepen, and I can't wait to implement those ideas on my portfolio webpages.

Yesterday, I encountered my first roadblock: configuring XAMPP for SQL and PHP server. The silver lining, however, was that I decided to set it aside. I discovered Codepen and Three.js, which I had never seen such amazing animation and designs right at my fingertips. This just made web development a thousand times more interesting.

Today I coded: 

1. A Navigation Bar
2. 3 more Subdirectories 
3. Used Google Fonts
4. Created a form on HTML

A necessity for most websites. While reviewing the navigation bar code that ChatGPT provided, I familiarized myself with additional CSS styles. Creating a separate container from the header to style the navigation bar individually proved to be a wise choice. I also learned how to open new directories or files in a new tab by clicking on the words in the navigation bar.

Today, I established three new folders containing HTML, CSS, JS, and JSON files for three additional webpages. By comprehensively understanding and annotating the code with comments, I was able to eliminate unnecessary elements and incorporate new, pertinent code for the new webpages.

Today, I took a brief exploration into Google Fonts and integrated them into my contact subdirectory. Moving forward, I will exclusively utilize customized fonts. Additionally, I recognize the importance of maintaining a consistent hierarchy within my CSS stylings.

sections.point: Created a form and animated it when clicked
sections.content: With guidance from ChatGPT, I successfully implemented an HTML form. The process was straightforward, and I further enhanced the form by effortlessly incorporating an engaging animation

Today was highly productive. I deepened my understanding of absolute positioning and gained insights into the essential steps required for complete webpage customization. My future pursuits include delving into advanced techniques such as CSS Flexbox and CSS Grid. Subsequently, I am determined to craft a meticulously designed and visually appealing website without any concessions

This morning, I engaged in a goal-setting session and made the deliberate choice to invest my time and effort in crafting webpages that epitomize beauty and emphasize the essence of user experience (UX) and user interface (UI). I have decided to do 3  webpages: 

1. A personal portfolio website, 
2. A website for a burger-centric business, 
3. A website for a fashion brand.

Upon the completion of these three projects, I plan to venture into the realms of C++, Java, and Python. I intend to create engaging games, develop useful backend software, and immerse myself in the intricate world of hacking culture.
Today, I successfully constructed the front page of a burger-themed website.

I derived inspiration from diverse sources, including this webpage: (https://5scontent.com/homepage/) which provided me with insights into creative fading techniques. Additionally, the Mos Burger webpage (https://www.mosburger.com.sg/) influenced the elegant arrangement of food items and text that I incorporated into my project.

Navigating the nuances of applying fade effects, tweaking opacity, and managing timing became manageable once I revisited the code that ChatGPT had previously provided. This review enabled me to comprehend the specific functions associated with each webpage element. I encountered a challenge while aligning the containers at the center of the page. Whenever I increased the container width, the right side expanded, causing the container to tilt to the right. I realized that I needed to apply a margin-left attribute to the container's CSS class. This experience also underscored the importance of understanding the precedence of CSS styles. Integrating additional effects into pre-existing code created by others led to overlapping styles, necessitating meticulous sorting. Through a line-by-line examination, I resolved these issues and deepened my understanding of the code's significance.

Designing a captivating website demands substantial dedication and time investment. Every pixel warrants attention, and meticulous attention to detail is crucial. I approach the upcoming days with a blend of enthusiasm and apprehension, realizing that the journey ahead resembles a bottomless pit of boundless enhancements.

posts.title: Embarking on My Journey as a Software Engineer

sections.content: It was the 7th of August, 2023, a day that marked the beginning of my dedicated journey towards becoming a skilled software engineer. My programming journey commenced back in 2019, with tutorials on Python and JavaScript. Fast forward to 2021, I enrolled in a university course on Python fundamentals and data analytics, which provided me a solid grasp of object-oriented programming. Additionally, I recently completed NandtoTetris Part 1, delving into the intricate workings of computers. This course, undertaken by NTU students in their first year, proved to be one of the most challenging experiences I've encountered. In the realm of design, I also ventured into Google's UX design certification, courtesy of a free Coursera account from my school. While insightful, I couldn't help but notice the contrasting difficulty level between technological and design courses. Designers, I dare say, seem to have it easier. Now, after a year-long hiatus and equipped with a bachelor's degree in accounting, I've made the resolute decision to embrace this journey wholeheartedly.

Today, I immersed myself in the guidelines for NUS CS freshmen, deriving a significant dose of motivation and a deeper understanding of the essence of hacking. This process further ignited my interest, convincing me that I possess the potential to excel as a proficient programmer. With the guidance of codes from ChatGPT, I've laid the initial groundwork for this blog. Having already grasped the fundamentals of HTML and CSS, I'm now venturing into JavaScript, with plans to progressively enhance this blog's features over time.

While specific short-term goals are yet to be finalized, my current daily schedule is already in place. Mornings from 8 to 12, afternoons from 2 to 6, and evenings from 9 to 11 are designated for intensive engagement with my computer. This rigorous regimen guarantees a minimum of 10 hours each day devoted to coding and learning.

Today, I delved into the guidelines tailored for NUS CS freshmen once again. The insights gained from this activity provided a fresh wave of motivation and a deeper understanding of what defines a hacker. I felt an invigorating surge of interest, reinforcing my belief that I possess the attributes required to excel as a remarkable programmer. My endeavors also encompassed laying the foundational framework for this blog, leveraging codes sourced from ChatGPT. Having already acquired a sound grasp of HTML and CSS, I'm presently engrossed in the realm of JavaScript. As time unfolds, my plan entails enriching this blog with an array of progressive features.
